title: MBD-Framework: Memory as Baseline Deviation — Computational Labs
description:
MBD-Framework provides 18 standalone simulation labs demonstrating the key phenomena across a six-paper series on Memory as Baseline Deviation (MBD) — a formal framework that models personality, cognition, and social dynamics as state-space systems.

Core Equation

B(t+1) = B(t)(1 − λ) + I(t) · λ

An agent's personality is not a label — it is a vector in state space. Every significant experience shifts that vector. λ is the plasticity parameter — how deeply the event rewrites who you are.

The 18 Labs

  • Paper 1 — Baseline Deviation (6 labs): Two-agent convergence, ADHD plasticity, ossification, Shaken Baby Syndrome, phantom limb, bipolar cycling
  • Paper 2 — Markov Tensor (1 lab): Echo chamber convergence → shock → catastrophic fragmentation
  • Paper 3 — Episodic Recall (1 lab): Novelty-gated encoding, context-scaffolded recall
  • Paper 4 — Coupling Asymmetry (5 labs): ASPD, BPD, parasitic coupling, internalised Other, DID fragmentation
  • Paper 5 — Emergent Gate (2 labs): Mood-incongruent recall, dual resonance
  • Paper 6 — Resonant Gate (3 labs): Phase-locked coupling, zeta integration, deontological pressure tests

Also Includes

  • Core MBD equations (analysis/trauma_model.py) — Baseline, TraumaForm, update_baseline, update_kappa
  • Interactive notebooks (notebooks/) — Jupyter walkthroughs of Paper 1 and Paper 4
  • Web UI (lab/) — FastAPI + React/Recharts interactive lab runner

Coupling dynamicsdκ/dt = α(1 − N) − βκRelationships strengthen in familiarity, fracture in novelty

Accompanying Papers

  1. Memory as Baseline Deviation — Personality as state-space dynamics; baseline drift under trauma
  2. In Pursuit of the Markov Tensor — Geometric framework for social cognition via tensor lattices
  3. Episodic Recall as Resonant Re-instantiation — Fokker–Planck account of memory retrieval dynamics
  4. The Coupling Asymmetry — Executive dysfunction as an eigenstate of the memory–baseline system
  5. The Emergent Gate — Memory encoding as threshold-dependent consolidation
  6. The Resonant Gate — Conversational insight as phase-locked coupling

Quick Start

pip install -r requirements.txt
python -m labs.paper1_baseline.eq_lab       # Run any lab from CLI
python -m labs.paper4_coupling.phenomena_bpd
jupyter notebook notebooks/                 # Interactive walkthroughs

Requires Python ≥ 3.10, numpy, pydantic, matplotlib. Licensed under Apache 2.0.
notes: 18 standalone simulation labs for the MBD paper series. Each lab exposes describe()/run()/plot() for reproducible demonstrations. Includes Jupyter notebooks, FastAPI + React web UI, and core MBD equations.
